alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 26 at 9:06AM AKDT until May 26 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ......RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 220, 221, 222 AND 223 FROM DELTA JUNCTION AND FT YUKON WEST FROM NOON TO 10 PM TODAY... .DISCUSSION...High pressure aloft building over the West Coast and Interior of Alaska will cause a warming trend through the weekend over Interior Alaska, with highs in the 60s and lower 70s rising into the 70s over the weekend. The current dry conditions will remain through Fri, with a slight increase in moisture over the weekend as evaporating moisture builds up under the high aloft. A thermal low pressure trough stretching from Northway to Ft Yukon to Ambler will intensify today, then weaken in place Fri and Sat. This will cause west winds of 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph in the afternoon and evening today, with winds decreasing Fri. Given the dry fuels and warm, dry conditions, these winds will cause Red Flag Conditions from Delta Junction west today. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR YUKON FLATS AND SURROUNDING UPLANDS...CENTRAL INTERIOR...MIDDLE TANANA VALLEY AND DELTANA AND TANANA FLATS... The National Weather Service in Fairbanks has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon today to 10 PM AKDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Interior Alaska from Delta Junction and Ft Yukon west. * TIMING...Noon to 10 PM today * WINDS...West 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low at 17 to 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...65 to 77. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires will be possible.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
